repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - National Program Support for
            Basic Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the National Program Support
            for Basic Education Project for Philippines were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was moderate; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the
            institutionalization of reforms requires a long- term
            commitment on the part of government and the donor community
            to support the reform agenda. School Based Management (SBM)
            is an important tool for decentralizing an education system
            and improving learning outcomes. Public private partnerships
            are important for ensuring the long-term availability of
            adequate resources to support community schools. Solid
            analytical studies on system reforms during the
            implementation period are essential for making appropriate
            decisions on the elimination of bottlenecks to the reform
            agenda. Strong financial management systems are critical for
            ensuring the efficient use and accounting of resources. A
            report-based disbursement system is more efficient than a
            statement of expenses disbursement system for a large
            education bureaucracy. Bank support can play an important
            role in leveraging money for government policy reforms.

16220402.trustfund:
TF055141-PHRD-PHILIPPINES: BASIC
            EDUCATION SECTOR REFORM PROGRAM

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - National Program Support for
            Basic Education Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Program Support for Basic
            Education Project aims to improve quality and equity in
            learning outcomes for all Filipinos in basic education. The
            closing date for the project will be extended from December
            31, 2011 to December 31, 2012. The extension is necessary to
            allow the department of education to complete the
            procurement and delivery of the English, Mathematics, and
            Science and Technology textbooks to be financed under the
            project. The implementing agency, the Department of
            Education, has prepared an action plan as well as a revised
            procurement plan and disbursement schedule to complete the
            project. This will be the first extension of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Philippines - National Program
            Support for Basic Education Project : restructuring (Vol. 2)
            : Data sheet
